reference.title: SQL Results view
reference.shortdesc: Displays the status and results of SQL statements entered using the SQL Scrapbook.

section.p: The SQL Results view is divided into two halves. The left half consists of the following:

strow.stentry: Filter field (unlabeled)

(this field is located above the table, and spans the entire left half of the view) Filters the rows in the following table. Only those rows that have an operation containing the words listed here are displayed. Clear this field to see all of the SQL operations that have been performed.
Result of the corresponding SQL operation, such as Failed or Succeeded.
SQL operation that was performed.
When the SQL operation was performed.
The connection profile that was used when performing the SQL operation.

section.p: Select a row in the table on the left side of the SQL Results view to see the actual results of the operation. Depending upon the operation that was performed, the right half is usually organized into one or more of the following tabs (if the "Display result in a single tab" control is selected, the right half will show the results of the operation and the elapsed time in a single tab):

strow.stentry: Displays the SQL statement(s) executed, the status of the operation, and the elapsed time.
Displays parameter names, data types, values, and parameter types for a routine procedural object.
Displays any output from the operation. For instance, if you execute a SELECT statement the table rows are displayed here.

section.p: The SQL Results view contains the following controls:

strow.stentry: Terminate Result
Terminates a long-running SQL operation. Note that this control only active when a SQL operation is in progress.
Remove Result
Deletes the selected result. This control is not active if you haven't selected a results row.
Remove all Visible Results

Deletes all of the displayed results. Note that you can use the Filter Results control () and the filter field to select the set of results that is to be deleted; this control does not delete results that aren't currently displayed.
Display result in a single tab
Presents the results of the selected SQL operation in a single tab.
Display result in text mode
Presents the results of the selected SQL operation in a set of tabs as described above.
Filter Results
Displays the SQL Results Filters dialog, from which you can filter the results in various ways.

section.p: Right-click in the results to copy, save, export (as xml, text, or other), or print the displayed results.
